definition: (fig.) to itch (to do sth)
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
variant of 癢|痒[yang3]/to itch/to tickle
to itch/to tickle

sentences.english: In 2013, Barton felt the itch to get back to work.
sentences.chinese: 到了2013年，他又觉得手痒，想重返工作岗位。

sentences.english: Well, me hearties, it's just itchin' for a remake.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，我的朋友，这不过是一时手痒要重拍而已。

sentences.english: After hibernating for months, they are itching for action.
sentences.chinese: 在冬眠了几个月之后，他们开始手痒想行动。

sentences.english: My fingers itch to box his ears.
sentences.chinese: 是手痒得想打他一个耳光。

sentences.english: As long for the wife lord lets the time of matchless hand Yang go to wager up several pair ofs liked.
sentences.chinese: 只要妻主让无双手痒的时候去赌上几把就好了。

sentences.english: One's fingers itch to do sth.

definition: lit. itchy heart/to be itching to do sth (idiom)
to be eager to give sth a try (idiom)
to itch/to tickle
lit. seeing others go hunting, one is excited by memories of the thrill of the hunt (idiom)/fig. seeing others do what one loves to do, one is inspired to try it again
to be unable to hold back
variant of 癢|痒[yang3]/to itch/to tickle
to itch/to tickle
to be prompted by a sudden impulse/carried away by a whim/to have a brainstorm
to become agitated/to feel nervous
not well/out of sorts/in a bad mood/without discrepancy/accurate
to begin to stir (idiom)/to get restless/to become threatening
cannot help/unable to bear
to covet/to envy
lit. isn't that a joy? (quote from Confucius)/fig. (jocularly) extremely/awfully
addiction/craving
bored/boring/senseless
to satisfy a craving/to get a kick out of sth/gratifying/immensely enjoyable/satisfying/fulfilling
